DataElement.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Preparation Embedding Standard Operating Procedure Name Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the SOP governing the paraffin embedding of the BPV FFPE tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Preparation Embedding Standard Operating Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04)_Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin._The act or process of making something ready._To surround an object with a firm chemical substance such as wax or resin, in order to perform cutting of thin sections for microscopic examination._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
The act or process of making something ready.
